Kembangkan Geopark, Sukabumi Jalin Kerja Sama dengan Jepang
07 Nov 2019, 02:58 by Ahmad Rayadie
PALABUHANRATU, (PR).- Setelah melalui berbagai tahapan dan pembahasan intensif, akhirnya pengembangan Ciletuh Palabuhanratu Unesco Global Geopark (CPUGGp) mendapat respon positif dari Pengelola Izu Peninsula Unesco Global Geopark (IPUGGp). Hal tersebut diungkapkan, Bupati Sukabumi, Marwan Hamami, Kamis, 7 November 2019, setiba di tanah air usai menandatangi Nota Kesepahaman Bersama di Main Building Shizuoka, Perfecture Jepang.
Nota kesepahaman tersebut ditandatangani pada Rabu, 6 November 2019, dengan disaksikan Gubernur Jawa Barat, M. Ridwan Kamil. MoU ditandatangani President of Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council, Mr Kikuchi. Sementara perwakilan dari Kabupaten Sukabumi pada nota kesepahaman tersebut ditandatangi Ketua Badan Pengelola CPUGGp, Iyos Somantri.
Pada kesempatan tersebut, Gubernur Shizuoka Mr. Heita Kawahatsu, serta Walikota Shimoda City selaku Vice President of Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council turut menyaksikan.
"Kami merasa bangga atas dukungan maksimal kedua gubernur hingga terjadi  kesepahaman," kata Marwan Hamami.
Marwan mengatakan, nota kesepahaman akan segera ditindaklanjuti pada tataran operasionalnya. Diharapkan kerjasama ini nantinya akan memberikan kemajuan yang signifikan bagi kedua geopark. Apalagi keberadaannya, tidak saja sebagai daerah tujuan wisata, konservasi dan pemberdayaan.
"Tapi mengedukasi masyarakat akan pentingnya memelihara taman bumi sebagai warisan geologi. Kami berharap telah ditandatangi kedua belah pihak  bisa  penguatan promosi dan pelatihan Sumber Daya Manusia (SDM) serta merupakan peluang untuk bisa melakukan export produk hasil pertanian dan perikanan di wilayah pemberdayaan geopark," katanya.
Gubernur Jawa Barat M.Ridwan Kamil  mengatakan langkah yang dilakukannya merupakan dukungannya atas kesepahaman bersama mengingat Pemprov Jabar telah melakukan Pembentukan Provinsi-Prefektur Bersaudara antara Pemerintah Daerah Povinsi Jawa Barat dengan Pemerintah Prefektur hizuoka, Jepang.
Ketua Badan Pengelola CPUGGp, Iyos Somantri mengatakan setelah penandatanganan MOU dengan President of Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council, akan segera dilakukan implementing agrement.
"Secepatnya kami akan lakukan implementing agrement atau Perjanjian Kerjasama dalam bidang ekonomi, budaya, lingkungan hidup serta pemberdayaan" ungkapnya.
Iyos Somantri mengatakan ada  beberapa poin penting pada perjanjian yang di tuangkan. Selain kerja sama di bidang promosi dan pendidikan. 
Telah disepakat kedua belah pihak akan berbagi pengetahuan dalam praktik memperkuat inisiatif bersama masing-masing pihak. Dan perjanjian tersebut dilaksanakan selama 5 tahun dan dapat di perpanjang  melalui surat usulan dari kedua pewakilan.
"Inisiatif-inisiatif tersebut dilaksanakan dalam setiap kegiatan  Pameran geopark, museum bersama atau pusat pengunjung serta mendukung inisiatif sekolah wilayah geopark untuk pembelajaran berbasis internet untuk saling mempromosikan," katanya.***

Developing Geopark, Sukabumi Establishes Cooperation with Japan
Nov 7 2019, 02:58 by Ahmad Rayadie
PALABUHANRATU, (PR) .- After going through various stages and intensive discussions, finally the development of Ciletuh Palabuhanratu Unesco Global Geopark (CPUGGp) received a positive response from the Manager of the Izu Peninsula Unesco Global Geopark (IPUGGp). This was revealed, Sukabumi Regent, Marwan Hamami, Thursday, November 7, 2019, after arriving in the homeland after signing a Memorandum of Understanding at the Main Building in Shizuoka, Japan Prefecture.
The memorandum of understanding was signed on Wednesday 6 November 2019, witnessed by the Governor of West Java, M. Ridwan Kamil. The MoU was signed by the President of the Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council, Mr. Kikuchi. While the representative of Sukabumi Regency in the memorandum of understanding was signed by the Chairman of the CPUGGp Management Board, Iyos Somantri.
On this occasion, the Governor of Shizuoka Mr. Heita Kawahatsu, and Mayor of Shimoda City as Vice President of the Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council also watched.
"We are proud of the maximum support of the two governors to reach an understanding," Marwan Hamami said.
Marwan said that the memorandum of understanding would soon be followed up at the operational level. It is hoped that this collaboration will provide significant progress for both geoparks. Moreover, its existence, not only as a tourist destination, conservation and empowerment.
"But educating the public on the importance of preserving the earth park as a geological heritage. We hope that both parties have been signed to strengthen the promotion and training of Human Resources (HR) as well as an opportunity to be able to export agricultural and fishery products in the geopark empowerment area," he said .
West Java Governor M. Ridwan Kamil said the step he took was his support for a mutual understanding given that the West Java Provincial Government had formed the Formation of Brothers Provinces between the West Java Provincial Government and the Hizuoka Prefectural Government, Japan.
The Chairperson of the CPUGGp Management Agency, Iyos Somantri, said that after the signing of the MOU with the President of the Izu Peninsula Geopark Promotion Council, an implementing agrement would be carried out immediately.
"We will immediately implement an agrement or Cooperation Agreement in the fields of economy, culture, environment and empowerment," he said.
Iyos Somantri said there were several important points in the agreement that were set forth. Besides cooperation in the field of promotion and education.
It has been agreed that both parties will share knowledge in the practice of strengthening joint initiatives of each party. And the agreement is carried out for 5 years and can be extended through a letter of proposal from the two representatives.
"These initiatives are carried out in every geopark exhibition, joint museum or visitor center activity and support the geopark region school initiative for internet-based learning to promote one another," he said. ***
